answers.author: Jared Cobb
answers.text:
I would also check with your Finance Department to see what their threshold is for recording fixed assets. Some states have specific accounting requirements (i.e. $5,000 and 10-year life) and you will want to draft a policy that is consistent. 
We maintain a Capital Improvement Plan and an Equipment Replacement Plan. Equipment between $5,000-75,000 is placed on the ERP, whereas construction projects and equipment above $75,000 is included in the CIP. All of the items are budgeted as a capital asset and recorded as a fixed asset.

author: Lindsay Harris
text: What is the criteria to be a capital project in a Capital Improvement Plan/Program (vs operating)?  Examples: minimum expenditure; minimum useful life; construction, modfications, and/or acquisitions; on-going maintenance/replacement; technology.
title: Criteria to be a Capital Project
